title: Shakespeare's Globe On Screen Titus Andronicus (2014)
description:
Shakespeare's Globe On Screen Titus Andronicus (2014)
produced by Opus Arte

Run time 2 hr 47 mins. 

Directed for the stage by Lucy Bailey
Directed for the screen by Ian Russell
 	
Designer, William Dudley
composer, Django Bates  
choreographer, SiÃƒÂ¢n Williams 
fight director, Terry KIng 
 
executive producers, Dominic Dromgoole, Robert Marshall ; producers, Lotte 
Buchan, Jessica Lusk. 

Cast

Titus Andronicus  William Houston
Lavinia           Flora Spencer Longhurst
Tamora            Indra Varma
Saturninus        Matthew Needham

  (complete cast list at the conclusion)

Summary
 	
A live performance of the tragedy "Titus Andronicus" by William 
Shakespeare. Set in Roman times, the play deals with the bloody revenge of 
Roman general Titus Andronicus for the atrocities committed against his 
family by Tamora, the captive queen of the Goths, and her faction. 

My notes

This fileshare from the Globe series is considerably smaller and therefore 
more accessible than others I've made.  This Titus should 
encourage libraries and individuals to acquire all in the series in their 
original and annotated DVD form.

I've seen the Ambrose/BBC Titus and the Julie Taymor film of the play as 
well.  But perhaps of most current interest is the revival of the Grand Guinol (Big Puppet) theatre style.  Unlike the name implies it was the most extreme form of stage display of violence and gore in modern 
times.  And it is referenced in the current dramatic television series 
"Penny Dreadful."   Another television note is that Indra Varma appears as 
Tamora whom some will recognize from the series "Rome" of a few years ago.

To give away more would spoil the experience but you will find that the live audience reactions to the play are unique.



Notes written  September 22, 2015
